description: Indulge in the classic Italian dessert with this irresistible Tiramisu. Layers of delicate, coffee-soaked ladyfingers are alternated with a rich and creamy mascarpone cheese mixture, infused with a hint of vanilla and a touch of cocoa.

instructions.instruction: Brew the espresso and let it cool. Mix in the rum if using.

In a heatproof bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and sugar. Place the bowl over a pot of simmering water (double boiler) and whisk continuously until the mixture is pale and slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
In a separate bowl, beat the mascarpone cheese until smooth. Gradually fold the egg yolk mixture into the mascarpone until fully combined.
In another bowl, whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form. Gently fold the whipped cream into the mascarpone mixture until smooth and creamy.
Quickly dip each ladyfinger into the coffee mixture, ensuring they are soaked but not soggy. Layer half of the soaked ladyfingers in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone cream over the ladyfingers. Repeat with another layer of soaked ladyfingers and the remaining mascarpone cream.
Cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight. Before serving, dust the top with cocoa powder.

description: Enjoy a rich and creamy Chicken Alfredo with perfectly cooked chicken breasts in a velvety Alfredo sauce. This comforting dish is made with a blend of Parmesan cheese, butter, and heavy cream, served over a bed of fettuccine pasta.

instructions.instruction: Cook the fettuccine according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then cook for about 6-7 minutes per side, or until fully cooked and golden brown. Remove from the skillet and slice into strips.
In the same skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
Pour in the heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and stir in the Parmesan cheese until the sauce is smooth and creamy.
Add the cooked chicken strips back into the skillet and stir to coat with the sauce. Let it simmer for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Add the cooked fettuccine to the skillet and toss to combine with the sauce and chicken.
Serve immediately, garnished with chopped parsley and extra Parmesan cheese if desired.

description: Savor the rich, creamy goodness of Beef Stroganoff. Tender strips of beef are cooked with mushrooms and onions in a savory sour cream sauce, served over egg noodles or rice for a comforting meal.

instructions.instruction: Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef strips and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the remaining butter. Sauté the onions and mushrooms until they are tender and golden brown.
Stir in the garlic and cook for an additional minute. Sprinkle the flour over the mushrooms and onions and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Slowly add the beef broth, stirring continuously to avoid lumps. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until the sauce has thickened.
Reduce heat to low and stir in the sour cream. Return the beef to the skillet and heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the Beef Stroganoff over egg noodles or rice, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

description: This vibrant Greek Salad is a refreshing combination of juicy tomatoes, crisp cucumbers, tangy olives, and creamy feta cheese, all drizzled with a zesty olive oil and lemon dressing.

instructions.instruction: In a large bowl, combine the chopped cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, red onion, olives, and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

description: Experience the crispy, golden perfection of Tonkatsu. This Japanese breaded pork cutlet is served with a savory Tonkatsu sauce and a side of shredded cabbage, offering a delightful crunch and flavor in every bite.

instructions.instruction: Pound the pork chops to an even thickness. Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Coat each pork chop in flour, shaking off excess. Dip into beaten eggs, then coat with panko breadcrumbs, pressing gently to adhere.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the pork chops for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Drain on paper towels.
Slice the Tonkatsu into strips and serve with Tonkatsu sauce and shredded cabbage.

description: Cool off with a classic Piña Colada, a tropical cocktail made with a blend of rum, coconut cream, and pineapple juice. This creamy, fruity drink is perfect for a sunny day or a festive occasion.

instructions.instruction: Combine the rum, coconut cream, pineapple juice, and ice cubes in a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy. Adjust the consistency with more ice or pineapple juice if needed.
Pour into glasses and garnish with a pineapple slice and maraschino cherry if desired.

description: A classic holiday treat, Eggnog is a creamy, spiced beverage made with eggs, milk, and cream, often spiked with a splash of rum or bourbon. Enjoy this festive drink chilled or warm.

instructions.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and sugar until pale and thickened.
In a saucepan, heat the milk and cream over medium heat until just about to simmer. Gradually whisk the hot milk mixture into the egg yolk mixture.
Pour the mixture back into the saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches 160°F (71°C). Do not boil.
Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla extract and nutmeg. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.
If using, stir in the rum or bourbon before serving. Garnish with additional nutmeg or cinnamon if desired.

description: Eggs Benedict is a luxurious brunch dish featuring poached eggs and Canadian bacon on toasted English muffins, topped with a rich and creamy hollandaise sauce. Perfect for a special occasion or a decadent breakfast.

instructions.instruction: To make the hollandaise sauce, melt the butter in a saucepan. In a bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and lemon juice. Gradually whisk in the melted butter until the sauce is thick and smooth. Season with salt and pepper.

Bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer. Crack each egg into a small bowl, then gently slide the egg into the simmering water. Cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Toast the English muffins and top each half with a slice of Canadian bacon. Place under the broiler for 1-2 minutes to warm through.
Top each muffin half with a poached egg and spoon the hollandaise sauce over the top. Garnish with fresh chives or parsley if desired.

description: Croque-Madame is a classic French sandwich featuring ham and melted Gruyère cheese, topped with a perfectly fried egg. It’s a decadent twist on the Croque-Monsieur, perfect for a brunch or light lunch.

instructions.instruction: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Spread Dijon mustard on one side of each slice of bread. Top with ham and Gruyère cheese, then place another slice of bread on top to form a sandwich.
In a skillet, melt 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Cook the sandwiches until golden brown on each side, about 3-4 minutes per side. Transfer to a baking sheet.
Spread a thin layer of béchamel sauce over the top of each sandwich and sprinkle with additional Gruyère cheese. Bake in the oven for 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Meanwhile, fry the eggs in a separate skillet to your liking (sunny-side up is traditional).
Top each sandwich with a fried egg and serve immediately.

description: Chicken Teriyaki features tender chicken glazed with a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce, served over rice or with vegetables. It’s a quick and flavorful meal that captures the essence of Japanese cuisine.

instructions.instruction: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, mirin, sake, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger to make the teriyaki sauce.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
Pour the teriyaki sauce over the chicken and simmer for a few minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken.
Slice the chicken and serve over rice or alongside steamed vegetables, garnished with chopped green onions or sesame seeds if desired.

description: Experience the rich and creamy texture of classic French Crème Brûlée. This elegant dessert features a smooth custard base topped with a perfectly caramelized sugar crust, creating a delightful contrast between the creamy custard and the crunchy top layer.

instructions.instruction: Preheat your oven to 325°F (160°C). Place a rack in the center of the oven.
In a medium saucepan, heat the heavy cream over medium heat until it starts to simmer. Remove from heat and add the vanilla bean paste or extract. Let it steep for about 10 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and granulated sugar until the mixture is pale and slightly thickened.
Slowly pour the warm cream into the egg yolk mixture while continuously whisking to prevent the eggs from curdling.
Strain the custard mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a large measuring cup or bowl to remove any curdled bits.
Divide the custard mixture evenly among four ramekins. Place the ramekins in a baking dish and add hot water to the baking dish until it reaches halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 35-40 minutes, or until the custards are set but still slightly jiggly in the center.
Remove the ramekins from the baking dish and let them cool to room temperature. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 3 days.
Before serving, sprinkle an even layer of granulated sugar over the top of each custard. Use a kitchen torch to caramelize the sugar until it forms a golden, crispy crust.

ingredients.quantity: 1 vanilla bean or 1 tsp vanilla bean paste

description: Experience a burst of flavors with this Kung Pao Chicken. This popular Chinese dish features tender chicken chunks stir-fried with crunchy peanuts, fresh vegetables, and a spicy, tangy sauce that brings everything together.

instructions.instruction: Cut the chicken breast into bite-sized pieces and marinate in soy sauce, rice wine, and cornstarch for at least 15 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix together the sauce ingredients: soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, hoisin sauce, and water. Set aside.
Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of oil and stir-fry the marinated chicken until cooked through and lightly browned. Remove from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add a little more oil if needed. Stir-fry the dried red chilies until they become aromatic. Add the garlic, ginger, and chopped bell peppers, and cook until vegetables are tender.
Return the chicken to the pan and pour the prepared sauce over everything. Stir to coat the chicken and vegetables with the sauce.
Add the roasted peanuts and stir to combine. Cook for another 2 minutes, allowing the sauce to thicken slightly.
Garnish with sliced green onions and serve hot over steamed rice or noodles.

ingredients.ingredient: chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces

description: Classic French pastries filled with creamy custard and topped with a rich chocolate glaze. Éclairs are perfect for special occasions or a sweet treat.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Prepare a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a saucepan, bring water, butter, and salt to a boil. Stir in flour until the mixture forms a dough.
Transfer the dough to a bowl and let it cool slightly. Beat in eggs one at a time until smooth.
Pipe the dough onto the prepared baking sheet in long strips. Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden brown.
Cool the éclairs completely before filling with custard and glazing with chocolate.

description: Thin, delicate pancakes that can be filled with sweet or savory fillings. Crêpes are versatile and perfect for breakfast or dessert.

instructions.instruction: In a bowl, whisk together flour, eggs, milk, and melted butter until smooth.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease it.
Pour a small amount of batter into the skillet and swirl to cover the surface.
Cook for about 1-2 minutes until the edges start to lift, then flip and cook the other side.
Serve warm with your choice of toppings or fillings.

description: A traditional Austrian pastry filled with spiced apples and raisins, wrapped in a flaky dough. Apple Strudel is a comforting and delicious dessert.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Roll out the strudel dough on a floured surface.
Mix together sliced apples, sugar, cinnamon, and raisins.
Spread the apple mixture over the dough, leaving a border around the edges.
Roll the dough tightly and place on a baking sheet. Brush with melted butter and bake for 30-40 minutes.
Allow to cool slightly before slicing and serving.

description: A sweet pastry made of layers of filo dough, filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with honey or syrup. Baklava is a rich and indulgent treat.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Brush a baking dish with melted butter.
Layer sheets of filo dough in the dish, brushing each layer with butter. Add a layer of chopped nuts.
Repeat layers of dough and nuts, finishing with a top layer of filo dough.
Cut into diamond shapes before baking. Bake for 45-50 minutes until golden brown.
While baking, heat honey and water in a saucepan until combined. Pour over the hot baklava once out of the oven.

description: Soft and chewy rice cakes made from glutinous rice flour, often filled with sweet red bean paste or other fillings. Mochi is a popular Japanese treat.

instructions.instruction: Mix glutinous rice flour with water to form a smooth batter.
Pour the batter into a lightly greased dish and steam for about 30 minutes until cooked.
Allow to cool, then cut into small squares. Optionally, fill with sweet red bean paste or other fillings.
Dust with cornstarch to prevent sticking and serve.

description: A refreshing Italian bread salad made with ripe tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, and crusty bread. Tossed with a tangy vinaigrette, Panzanella is perfect for summer.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut the bread into cubes and toast in the oven until golden brown.
In a large bowl, combine diced tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, and fresh basil.
Add the toasted bread cubes to the bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper. Pour over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Let the salad sit for about 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld before serving.

description: A classic Italian salad featuring ripe tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze and olive oil. Simple yet delicious.

instructions.instruction: Slice the tomatoes and mozzarella into rounds.
Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices alternately on a serving platter.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately or let it sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to blend.

description: A classic American salad with a mix of crisp apples, celery, walnuts, and grapes, dressed in a creamy mayonnaise dressing. Waldorf Salad is a light and crunchy dish.

instructions.instruction: In a large bowl, combine diced apples, sliced celery, chopped walnuts, and halved grapes.
In a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Toss the apple mixture with the mayonnaise dressing until well coated.
Chill the salad for at least 30 minutes before serving.

description: A popular salad featuring crisp romaine lettuce, crunchy croutons, and a creamy Caesar dressing made with garlic, anchovies, and Parmesan cheese.

instructions.instruction: In a large bowl, toss together chopped romaine lettuce and croutons.
In a small bowl, whisk together Caesar dressing, garlic, and anchovy paste.
Pour the dressing over the lettuce and croutons, tossing to coat evenly.
Sprinkle with freshly grated Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

description: Classic French toasts made from slices of bread dipped in a rich egg and milk mixture, then cooked until golden brown. Served with maple syrup and fresh berries for a delicious breakfast.

instructions.instruction: In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and cinnamon.
Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with butter.
Dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, coating both sides.
Cook the bread slices in the skillet until golden brown on each side, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Serve warm with maple syrup, fresh berries, or powdered sugar.

ingredients.quantity: Maple syrup, fresh berries, or powdered sugar

description: Japanese savory pancakes made with a batter of flour, eggs, and shredded cabbage, topped with a variety of ingredients like pork, seafood, and a rich okonomiyaki sauce.

instructions.instruction: In a large bowl, mix flour, eggs, and water to form a smooth batter.
Fold in shredded cabbage and any additional ingredients like cooked pork or seafood.
Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with oil.
Pour a portion of the batter into the skillet and spread into a round shape.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until the other side is golden brown.
Serve topped with okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, bonito flakes, and chopped green onions.

ingredients.quantity: Okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, bonito flakes, green onions

description: Fluffy Russian pancakes that are thick and tender, often served with sour cream, jam, or honey. Oladyi are perfect for a hearty breakfast or brunch.

instructions.instruction: In a bowl, mix together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, and melted butter.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients until just mixed; the batter will be thick.
Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil.
Drop spoonfuls of batter onto the skillet and cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve warm with sour cream, jam, or honey.

description: A classic French dish featuring breaded and fried chicken or veal stuffed with ham and Swiss cheese. It's crispy on the outside and melty on the inside, often served with a creamy sauce.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place chicken breasts between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound until thin.
Place a slice of ham and cheese on each chicken breast, then roll up and secure with toothpicks.
Dredge the chicken rolls in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a skillet and cook the chicken rolls until golden brown on all sides.
Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through.
Serve with a creamy sauce or your favorite side dishes.

description: A traditional French vegetable stew made with tomatoes, zucchini, bell peppers, eggplant, and onions. It's a flavorful and hearty dish, perfect for summer or as a side dish.

instructions.instruction: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onions and garlic, and cook until softened.
Add bell peppers and cook for another 5 minutes.
Stir in diced tomatoes, zucchini, and eggplant.
Season with salt, pepper, and herbs like thyme and basil.
Simmer for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender.

description: A quintessential British dish featuring crispy battered fish served with golden fries. It's a hearty and satisfying meal, often enjoyed with malt vinegar and tartar sauce.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C) for the fries.
Cut potatoes into fries and toss with oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes until crispy.
For the fish, mix flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. Gradually whisk in cold sparkling water to make a batter.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C).
Dip fish fillets in the batter and carefully fry in the hot oil until golden brown and cooked through.
Drain on paper towels and serve with the baked fries and your choice of condiments.

description: A comforting British dish made with a layer of savory ground meat (usually lamb) topped with creamy mashed potatoes. Baked until golden, it's a hearty and satisfying meal.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cook ground lamb or beef in a skillet over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add onions, carrots, and peas to the skillet and cook until vegetables are tender.
Stir in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add beef broth and Worcestershire sauce, and simmer until the mixture thickens.
Transfer the meat mixture to a baking dish and spread mashed potatoes on top.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the top is golden and the filling is bubbling.

description: A traditional Greek casserole made with layers of eggplant, ground meat, and a creamy béchamel sauce. Baked until golden and bubbling, Moussaka is a rich and comforting dish.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Slice eggplants and brush with olive oil. Roast in the oven until tender.
Cook ground beef or lamb with onions, garlic, and spices in a skillet until browned. Stir in tomato paste and cook for a few more minutes.
For the béchamel sauce, melt butter in a saucepan, whisk in flour, and cook for 2 minutes. Gradually add milk, whisking continuously, until the sauce thickens. Stir in grated cheese.
In a baking dish, layer roasted eggplant, meat sauce, and béchamel sauce. Repeat layers and finish with a layer of béchamel.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the top is golden and the casserole is bubbling.

description: Arepas are versatile Venezuelan and Colombian flatbreads made from cornmeal. They can be filled or topped with a variety of ingredients, such as cheese, meats, or avocados.

instructions.instruction: In a bowl, mix the cornmeal with warm water and a pinch of salt. Let it sit for a few minutes until the mixture thickens.
Form the dough into small, round patties, about 1/2 inch thick.
Heat a skillet or griddle over medium heat. Cook the arepas for 5-7 minutes on each side until they are golden brown and cooked through.
Serve warm with your choice of fillings or toppings.

description: Gallo Pinto is a traditional Costa Rican and Nicaraguan dish of rice and black beans cooked together with spices. It is often enjoyed as a hearty breakfast or side dish.

instructions.instruction: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and bell peppers, and cook until softened.
Stir in minced garlic and cook for another minute.
Add cooked rice and black beans to the skillet. Mix well.
Season with salt, pepper, and a splash of soy sauce or hot sauce, if desired.
Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is heated through.

description: Argentinian Empanadas are savory pastries filled with a variety of ingredients such as beef, onions, olives, and spices. They are baked or fried to a golden crisp.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) if baking.
In a skillet, cook ground beef with onions, garlic, and spices until browned and cooked through.
Stir in chopped olives, hard-boiled eggs, and any other desired fillings. Cook for a few more minutes.
Place spoonfuls of the filling onto empanada dough circles. Fold and seal the edges, crimping with a fork.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown, or fry in hot oil until crispy.

description: The Bellini is a classic Italian cocktail made with fresh peach purée and Prosecco. It's a refreshing and elegant drink perfect for any celebration.

instructions.instruction: In a blender, purée fresh peaches until smooth. Strain the purée through a fine mesh sieve to remove any pulp or solids.
Pour 2 ounces of peach purée into a chilled champagne flute.
Slowly top with chilled Prosecco, pouring gently to avoid too much froth.
Gently stir if needed and serve immediately.

description: Horchata is a traditional Mexican beverage made from rice, milk, vanilla, and cinnamon. It's a creamy and refreshing drink enjoyed by many.

instructions.instruction: Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Soak the rice in water for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Drain the rice and blend it with 2 cups of fresh water until smooth.
Strain the rice mixture through a cheesecloth or fine mesh sieve into a large bowl.
Add milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon to the strained liquid. Stir well to combine.
Chill in the refrigerator before serving over ice.

description: The Mojito is a classic Cuban cocktail known for its refreshing combination of mint, lime, and rum. It's perfect for a hot day or as a lively party drink.

instructions.instruction: In a glass, muddle fresh mint leaves with sugar and lime juice to release the mint's flavor.
Add rum and stir to combine.
Fill the glass with ice and top with soda water.
Garnish with additional mint leaves and a lime wedge. Serve immediately.

description: Experience the classic elegance of Austrian baking with this rich Sacher Cake. This decadent chocolate cake is topped with a smooth apricot glaze and a layer of dark chocolate ganache, creating a perfect blend of sweetness and sophistication.

instructions.instruction: Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). Grease and flour an 8-inch round cake pan.
In a medium bowl, sift together the flour, cocoa powder, and baking powder.
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Mix in the vanilla extract and melted chocolate until fully incorporated.
Gradually fold the dry ingredients into the wet mixture until just combined.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold the egg whites into the batter until evenly mixed.
Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once the cake is cooled, spread apricot jam evenly over the top and sides of the cake.
For the ganache, heat the heavy cream until it begins to simmer. Remove from heat and stir in the chopped chocolate until smooth. Let the ganache cool slightly before pouring it over the cake.
Spread the ganache evenly over the cake, allowing it to drip down the sides. Chill the cake until the ganache is set.
